paragraphs.text: This article is a quick guide to help you get the most out of Whimsical flowcharts. For a more interactive experience, check out this template: How to make a Flowchart

items.li: Open #breakpoint3 the file or folder you want to customize
Click the default icon next to the name of the file or folder
An icon picker menu will pop up
Choose an icon from the icon picker and customize its color if desired

paragraphs.text: Here's a quick start guide to help you get the most out of Whimsical wireframes.

description.text: There are three ways to enter wireframe mode:

items.li: Click the wireframe icon in the toolbar
Use the shortcut W
From the All tools menu (‚ûï sign in the toolbar) - The All tools menu can also be accessed with the shortcut /

paragraphs.text: To exit wireframe mode, select the ‚¨ÖÔ∏è arrow or use the keyboard shortcut Q :
Whimsical has a variety of frames and elements to choose from to build your wireframes. Choose a frame from the Frames option in the toolbar, or with the keyboard shortcut F:
Create a wireframe element, from the Elements option in the toolbar, or with the keyboard shortcut E:
Pro tip: Build out entire flows using Whimsical frames and elements combined with other tools like flowchart shapes, connectors, and icons. Check out this template for inspiration.

Most frames and elements have their own options in the contextbar that appears when you select them. We‚Äôve built in unique characteristics in the frames and elements, so you don‚Äôt have to do additional work.

items.li: Switching the status bar and keyboard on and off on a phone frame.
Changing the state of a button.
Adding and editing menu options and tabs.
Swapping 'Lorem ipsum' placeholder text with block text.

paragraphs.text: Tip: Check out this template for a quick look at all the frames and elements.
